snippet.textDisplay:
Seriously. Why are we making videos like this? This topic was a nightmare. How do you talk about a continent as diverse as Africa, to explain larger trends? Not only is there a wide variety of sources, experts disagree with each other on what they can predict about the future. So the time we took to rewrite this script over and over was insane.


Still, there is no chance this video won’t make people angry, on all sides of this issue. Some may not agree with the conclusions we have come to. Some will think there are other aspects we could and should have mentioned. Or lament that we generalized too much.


But we had to generalize or this video would just have become a hour-long documentary. And we think the topic is too important to not discuss it.


So we read a lot and talked too many experts with very different opinions and interpretations. Also we tried to prepare our sources in a way that walks you through our thought process and helps you to make up your own mind.


This video was sponsored by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation as part of a Grant. They did not take part in the production of the video though.


Sources and comments: https://sites.google.com/view/sourcesoverpopulationandafrica

snippet.textDisplay: Take note the public and non scientists consuming information on YouTube, including flat earth and creationism content: Kurzgesagt is the closest source you'll get to a scientific representation of big topics like this one on YouTube. This is a digestible format of true research.  You could write a review manuscript from this work. I'm a scientist and am so impressed and proud of Kurzgesagt's effort and quality. To hear how they are funded, what research they've performed and the topic at hand in such an objective, even-handed manner just blows me away. Your illustrations are getting better and better, too. Thank you for everything you have done.

snippet.textDisplay: “...universal access to contraception makes having kids a decision...” you people disgust me. You know what else is a decision, not having sex if you can't support a baby. All contraception does is to make people willing to have sex more to satisfy their perverse destructive desires, which leads to moral and social decay. Your goal is literally to kill as many people as you can before they are born. You start out by saying “overpopulation” is a bad thing without proving it. 11 billion people is a perfectly manageable and sustainable amount, especially in 100 years (with development in countries and advancements in technology).

snippet.textDisplay: Honestly, this is imho the worst video of this channel so far: it's far from being incisive, redundant in affirming the wrongness of generalizations, and overall it lacks exposition of data to sustain... well, anything at all. In the end. Maybe the only thing I can see stressed in the video is the importance of Contraception, Healt Care and Education. I'm not wiser than before, and a little frustrated by the loss of my time.

snippet.textDisplay: This is what will happen. The welfare state in the west will collapse, as a result western countries will focus on internal programs. The unlimited amount of aid that the West has been sending to Africa for the last few decades will stop. The economics growth caused by foreign investment will stop. The people in Africa will simply starve to death. Malthus will have the last laugh.
